data.text:
The world is changing.

Anyone, not everyone, with internet access can write a post, garner attention, fuel their startup, or monetize their creative work.

Here's how to build social capital, the currency of the new rich:
https://t.co/33gL2nfdvl
If you can't solve a problem with hard work, you can probably solve it by going on a walk.

Do whatever you want. When you do, you will make massive mistakes. At that point, you no longer want it, and slowly course correct toward what you really want. If you always do what others want for you, you will never discover what you want.

If you struggle with mental clarity:

- Pull out a piece of paper
- Write down all of your thoughts
- Cross out all of the distractions
- Focus on what’s left

A clear head can be as simple as putting your mind on paper and organizing it.
You actually can do whatever you want whenever you want, and if you have a decent set of values, you should.
there's nothing stopping you https://t.co/nWF1xfN5lq

You are learning every millisecond of the day.

Your mind is a sponge soaking in information. Being programmed. Being conditioned. Being told what to do and how to do it. For most people, this is unconscious.

If you were to learn, consciously, your life would turn around fast.

Dopamine tells you when something is important to your survival-wired brain.

Companies exploit this by testing combinations of fat, sugar, salt, fear, pleasure, and conviction to addict you.

Very few things are important, and it's your duty to discover and pursue them.

Your past doesn't exist.

It's just an image in your mind. But you decide to live as if that image were your reality. Even worse, you Photoshop that image. You make it worse than it was and it slowly dims the future image you could create.
Most new wealth is being generated in the digital space because its barrier of entry is skill, not money or location.

Dopamine is the secret behind both the successful and the failures.

You don't need to cut it out of your life.

You need to learn how to leverage it:
https://t.co/syQvdhW0OV
You aren't fulfilled because your mind makes sense of the world in stories and you stopped living your own.

Go on more walks. Walk for no reason. Walk to solve a problem. Walk to blow off steam. Walk to get outside. Walk to listen, read, and learn. Walk to escape distractions. Walk to improve your health. Walk to think. A simple walking habit can change absolutely everything.
The death of your business happens when you obsess over a website, logo, LLC, and taxes before you actually start getting customers.

If you're okay with 10 cents in your bank account, you won't see that as a problem.

If you're okay with 20 pounds of extra body fat, you won't do anything to change it.

Your standards – your settling point – will ruin you if they are absymally low.

Most people don't start businesses.

They start distractions.

They focus on everything except for building a product or service and getting customers.

If I were starting from scratch, here's exactly what I would do to avoid all the nonsense:
https://t.co/fSqdtxlbN8
Many successful people are born out of an overwhelming amount of negativity that they chose to use as fuel, not an excuse.
Building a project will teach you more than watching a tutorial ever will.
Normalize disappearing for 1 hour a day to build a better future for yourself.

How to start a billion dollar business:

Don't.

Start a one-person business.

Build enough cash flow to leave your job.

Build enough of an audience to fuel that dream company you want to start.

Focus on the skills and interests you can already help people with.
Most people end up 50 years old with the emotional maturity of a 15 year old.

If you're in your 20s:

- Experiment with new paths
- Start your business failures now
- Study the opposite of your beliefs
- Challenge yourself with new interests

The worst thing you can do is stop learning, growing, and changing your mind after leaving the school system.
It's okay to disappear and build the thing you've been putting off (that will make you a better person when you come back).
If you enjoyed this thread, consider sharing it so others can see the value they have collecting dust on their hard drive. https://t.co/B2D0Ibq47A

That's it.

I thought this topic was fascinating. It can be so simple.

I'm going to be writing about this in-depth on Saturday's Koe Letter.

Subscribe here if you want it or read a related issue:
https://t.co/35Gj805B89

That's why you charge so low for it. It costs less than eating out for lunch and people hopefully receive more than that in value and convenience.

Last, this type of product allows you to test what to go all in on. You can create, launch, and test 2-3 of them pretty quickly with

Final thoughts:

Yes, this is a very low-ticket product. You need a good amount of traffic to make a lot of money. But most beginners would be happy with a side-income as they build more of the business.

Yes, this is a quick and dirty way to create a product.

3) Build up from there

This is simply one run of your value ladder.

If your product does well, you can easily turn it into a freelance or consulting service, or you can build on top of it to create a course or community.

And, you already have a list of potential buyers.

2) Create content around that topic

- Write about people's pain points
- Give quick tips about the topic
- Emulate what others are doing in that space

Then, link to your product in the replies, in your bio, or in your story. Give yourself 30-60 days.

1) Dig into your archives

Do you have book notes you've taken?

Do you have an old project you've built?

Do you have systems you use for productivity or work?

Turn it into a template, framework, or guide and slap a $10-20 price tag on it.

A simple document that was collecting dust on his computer turned into $1000.

Most people don't know what to sell when their first product is already done. It's just sitting in their Notion, Kortex, or Google Drive.

But how do you actually do this?

One day, he found his old resume that got him his job.

He decided to slap $10 on it and promote it in his content.

He made $1000 from it relatively fast and knew he was onto something.

People loved it.

There's a lesson to this:

I recently had a conversation that blew my mind.

I spoke with John Hu, CEO of Stan, which is an online store to host digital products.

He previously worked at Goldman Sachs.

He started online by building an audience on TikTok around career coaching.

A few beliefs of mine:

- Everyone has something valuable enough to pay for

- Most businesses should have a digital product for extra high-margin revenue

- Most beginners should build cash flow with a digital product, then invest in that startup or ecommerce business

You have $100,000 trapped in your head.

(Or on your hard drive)

A thread on turning your knowledge into a simple yet hyper-profitable product:
The best sales strategy is being so clear with what they receive that they can't help but buy, and if they don't, it's not a selling problem, it's a product problem.

The secret is to be useful.

Create. Design. Build. Write. Sell. Learn. Dissect. Hypothesize. Synthesize. Help.

Contribute more value than you take.

Don't be a leech.

Why doesn't finding the "best" niche work?

Well... just look at how many people don't quit, but there are other reasons.

1) By default, you're entering a space that you know nothing about with people you don't care about.

2) That niche isn't going to be profitable if you don't

Stop trying to find a niche.

Instead, ask yourself:

- Who can I help the most?
- What can I help them achieve?
- Why should they care?

Focus solely on helping those people achieve that thing because they're lives wouldn't be the same without it.
The more technology advances, the more important it is to be a generalist, polymath, and creator.

My creator toolstack:

Beehiiv for email list and newsletter.

Stan for simple products, landing pages and payments.

Kortex for content, writing, planning, and never losing ideas.

After 5 years and trying every software under the sun, I've simplified everything down to this.
If you enjoyed this thread, share the first post so others can get through their negative emotions. https://t.co/lqzs1SjAAM

data.text:
I've talked about Tactical Stress in-depth multiple times in The Koe Letter.

Don't miss another issue by joining below.

I'll also send you a Simple Life Reset template for free.
https://t.co/d0C9sFBIQi

3) Learn and build like a mad scientist

Perform emotional alchemy with the stress, pain, and overwhelm.

Channel everything into that one meaningful goal.

Study and learn while your mind is primed to store all relevant information.

You'll make it through.

So, what do you do?

1) Feel into your situation

Become brutally aware of the life you don't want to live. Let your mind simmer with negativity.

2) Launch into the unknown

Make a stupid decision. Force yourself to pursue the dream you've been putting off. Sink or swim.

Here's the psychology behind it:

- You set a challenging goal that deep down you know you can achieve.

- You create a REAL deadline which eliminates distractions.

- It leverages your survival instincts to quickly learn what's necessary to stay alive

A joke that's so unfunny that it becomes funny.

Someone who is so dumb they become insightful.

Someone who is in so much pain they have no option but to find enjoyment.

This is a universal pattern.

Leverage it.

Reason #3

The Theme Of Going Full Circle.

Imagine a straight line with black on one end and white on another blended with a gradient.

Now, connect the two ends so it forms a circle.

There is an instant flip from black to white.

Reason #2

Parkinson's Law:

Work expands so as to fill the time allotted for completion.

When you launch yourself into the unknown, you threaten your survival, and you have less time to become a success.

Why does this work?

Reason #1

Goldfish grow to fit the take you put them in.

But if you keep them in a small bowl, they never grow.

The same is true for your mind.

In 2019, I got rid of everything I owned (except for a bad of clothes and my laptop) and flew to a different country.

In 2020, I signed a lease for an apartment that was 2x what I could afford. This forced me to make my business work.

The best decisions I've made are ones that most people see as stupid.

I'm good at making massive mistakes because I've realized that's what leads to massive growth.

In 2018, I maxed out my first credit card to try to make a business work.

- Investing the last of your money in a crazy business idea so you have no option but to succeed.

This isn't for the faint hearted.

Weak-minded people will try this and ruin their lives even further.

You must have absolute conviction in your ability to win.

Smart people understand this and create high-pressure situations to force growth in a positive direction.

I call this Tactical Stress.

Some examples:

- Moving across the country and forcing yourself to learn how to survive.

A sad truth:

Most people don't change until the pain is so great that they only have two choices: drown or launch in the opposite direction.

The best periods of my life came after a period of being absolutely fed up with the lack of progress I was making.

A thread on using negative energy to change your life:

Stop trying to learn "skills."

Nothing valuable is built with ONE skill.

Instead, learn individual techniques that allow you to build a project that others find useful.

Stack techniques, not skills, and you'll slowly reduce your chances of being replaced.
The greatest mistake you can make is not making any mistakes.

The mind is always listening.

If you're always focused on failure, you will fail. If you're always focused on success, you will succeed.

Your mind absorbs information that conditions you to acheive your goals, but most people's goal is to fail, they just aren't conscious of it.

A little known truth:

Skills are groups of techniques.

What??

When you start trying to acquire a skill like Photoshop, you don't sit around studying the software all day.

Instead, you start creating the project.

Then you hit a roadblock. You don't know how to complete a

Your mind is wired for survival.

*It remembers things that helps solve a problem, resolve a pain, or connect a pattern.*

When you build a project and get stuck, THAT'S when your mind wants to remember anything that can help.
If you haven't started the project, most of your learning is a wasteful mental masturbation.

How to master any skill fast:

- Stop studying
- Outline a project
- Start building it
- Hit a roadblock
- Research how to overcome it
- Repeat until completed

Most people get trapped in tutorial hell and have nothing to show for years of "learning."

We're addicted to our phones.

We're disconnected from nature.

Jobs are at the threat of replacement.

Schools and religious ideologies are losing trust.

We're going through a meaning crisis.

Here's how you navigate it:
https://t.co/mRC480tu2l

How I structure my mornings:

- 3-5 lever moving tasks
- 90-minute time blocks
- 15-30 minute walks between

Productivity, creativity, and health in its simplest form.

Repeat until you can sleep well knowing you laid a puzzle piece for your ideal future.

The problem isn't that you don't know what to work on. It's that you haven't tried anything outside of what your parents, teachers, and boss have assigned to you. You haven't experimented with life to the point of finding that one thing you can't help but work on.

Dopamine can either make you:

Rich or broke.
Jacked or soft.
Focused or distracted.

Powerful chemical.

Unfortunately, it ruins most people's lives. Here's how to avoid that:
https://t.co/ZtiGOl6YWW

If you aren't building toward something, most of your actions are meaningless and repetitive.

Your relationships stay surface-level.
Your work becomes robotic.
Your health starts to slip.

You need direction. Because without it, the only option is to get distracted.

urls.title: Learn This Skill If You Want To Thrive The Next 10 Years - Dan Koe
urls.description: The future of media is decentralized. Social media for news. Courses for education. Creators for knowledge.

data.text:
Here's a letter on how I write (and how you can start):
https://t.co/hvc7QlG4Dr

It's safe to say that if you want to do your own thing, you will have to write.


Emails
Messages
Posts
Articles
Video scripts
Curriculums
Landing pages, ads, captions

Most people never learn or practice writing and wonder why they aren’t seeing the traction they want.

Social media is the fast food of socialization.

Porn is the fast food of intimacy.

Video games are the fast food of achievement.

Netflix is the fast food of entertainment.

Meticulously tested combinations of digital fat, sugar, and salt that trigger your survival instincts.
Going on a walk is a micro dopamine detox.
If you become your environment, create better environments.

Broken Windows Theory:

Crime dramatically increases in an area with broken windows (a place where crime would happen). Crime decreases in a clean area.

The Lesson:

Your environment influences your behavior more than you think. Your room. Your workspace. Where you hang out.

If

My biggest fear is waking up to live the same life as everyone else over and over again. Doing work I don't care about for people I don't care about. Never understanding, always reacting. No energy or time to think, plan, build, or change. Stuck on the surface as decades pass by.

For my young ones out there who were raised to think that:

- Investing your allowance
- Saving any leftover money
- Investing in real estate
- Budgeting and hating your life

Were how you become "rich," this video is for you:
https://t.co/BWkszIaYOV

Do everything in your power to maintain focus on the intersection of what's needed, what matters, and what you feel most drawn to learn and build. If it's not needed, doesn't matter, or you don't care about it, you are wasting your life.
Tomorrows letter on The Meaning Crisis + how to live a meaningful life goes out tomorrow. You can read a slightly less meaningful letter and join the list here: https://t.co/6zIqwEUgc9

Most people live a quietly anxious life because they know they should be doing something other than what they're doing, but they don't do anything about it because they don't know what to do, so they keep doing the same thing to numb the pain that comes with change.

It’s pretty mind blowing.

What started as a few “esoteric health” accounts on Twitter is turning into a US health reform.

There no way in hell RFK got the info from mainstream sources.

Passionate individuals have a lot of power if they share their ideas and discoveries.

"Educated" isn't the right word.

"Schooled" or "indoctrinated" is.

This isn't a fight between red and blue. This is a fight between freedom and slavery. Slavery of the mind.

The difference between schooling and education is the difference between imposed order and emergent https://t.co/Q2O3Sbbu12
The problem with forcing a narrow (and silently destructive) worldview on the entire population is that eventually, people get sick of it and turn against you, even if they swore they never would.

My timeline is filled with optimism and focus on health, aesthetics, learning, building, thinking, technology, ecology, and economics. As someone who's been immaturely apolitical most of my life, these are values I can heavily get behind. Smells like a new Golden Age.
If you can predict everything they are going to say, they aren't thinking for themselves.

Most people haven't practiced thinking.

When you talk to them, you aren't talking to them. You're talking to the TV. Social media. Their parents. Their teachers. Their insecurities and trauma.

It's very robotic. The definition of inauthentic.

Disconnect and think more.

Most people are trapped in doing mode.

Niching their attention down to menial tasks and pleasures without a second thought of what they lead to.

They rarely allow themselves to be. So their actions are misaligned by default. They create a life they despise without knowing how.

A meaningful life is found in alignment:

Being – soaking in the beauty of reality.

Doing – contributing to the beauty of reality.

Becoming – increasing your capacity for beauty, enhancing both.

Being influences doing. Doing conditions your mind and influences who you become.
Read more in today's letter: https://t.co/6zIqwEUO1H

If you want to make $1 million in 1 year, break it down.

$1,000,000 / 12 = $83,333 per month

$83,333 / 30 = $2,777 per day

Land one $5000 client every other day.

Or sell 18 $150 products a day.

Thats 720 people to a page that converts at 2.5%.

Build a product, distribute.
"most people don't know what skills to learn that will be relevant in 20 years" https://t.co/dPzQxhgE7H

urls.title: If You Have Multiple Interests, Start This One-Person Business
urls.description: As a naive 20 year old, I have a utopian vision for the digital future. Of course, it's not all going to work out like I have it in my head. But that doesn't...

data.text:
Freelance work is exploding.

Remote work is the new normal.

Creator economy predictions are beyond optimistic.

AI and tech allow individuals to do more than old companies.

The future of one-person businesses is bright.

Here's my delusional vision:
https://t.co/pJ7E1u5AOw

Set aside 1 hour a day for the 2 most important people in your life:

1) You
2) The person you want to become

You can't fill anyone else's cup if you don't have anything to pour.
Do what works, in your own way, without getting in your own way.

What more people need to realize is that you were creative, excited, and free until your mind adopted its own limits and you became a know it all. You know where your future is headed. You know what you're doing today. You leave little room for discovery in the unknown.

Too much structure makes life mundane.

Too much spontaneity makes life chaotic.

Most of your quality of life stems from finding your own balance.

If you're lost, the answer is education.

If you're educated, the answer is execution.

If you're executing, the answer is persistence.

If you're persisting, the answer is experimentation.

The most powerful habit you can adopt:

Using the first hour of your day to build, write, or produce something of value.
If you aren't intentional with your time, the default option is to waste it.

How to clear your mind:

Walk more. Read more. Write more. Listen more. Lift more. Strategize more. Build more.

Scroll less. Indulge less. Criticize less. Ruminate less. Sit less. Procrastinate less.

You lack clarity because you fill your mind with junk and let ideas go stale.

urls.title: How To Join The Top 1% Of Intelligence (Full Guide) - Dan Koe
urls.description: People who score well on IQ tests usually land in the "conventional" stages of psychological development.

data.text:
There is a science to intelligence.

An art to getting what you want.

But most people think having a high IQ is the pinnacle of development.

Most people are wrong.

Here's how you increase your intelligence, leading to a rich and fulfilling life:
https://t.co/2O3qElNcze
Blaming others does absolutely nothing for your life and puts you in a position with zero power to change your situation.
If you don't have anyone to talk about your interests and passions with, start writing on the internet and you'll find them.

If you can hold a conversation about it, you can write about it.

If you can't hold a conversation about it, you should write about it.

If you don’t know what to write, write about the ideas you want to gain more traction in the world. Politics, health, business, or a specific passion or hobby. Every sentence you write is a vote for which ideas become a part of society.

The only things standing between where you are and where you want to be is belief, skill, and knowledge. Beliefs can be changed, skills can be trained, and knowledge can be acquired, but few people care about having a rich life. They find pleasure in the pain of staying the same.
Most people are so afraid of making mistakes that they make the biggest mistake of them all: not making mistakes.
The solution to imposter syndrome is to produce so much that your body of work speaks for itself.

Ego is the storyteller. The interpreter. The thing that allows you to make sense of the world. You don't dissolve or kill the ego. You grow beyond the limits that keep it narrow and destructive. You expand yourself to the point of higher perspective and holistic storytelling.
Average people do average things https://t.co/JqxrvYmqaI

urls.title: How Smart Creators Will Build An Audience In 2025 - Dan Koe
urls.description: Your follower count doesn't matter anymore. We're going back to the old way of building an audience.

data.text:
If you don't have something to invest your focus in, maybe try writing about your multiple interests:
https://t.co/pEf69fVDy3
You're distracted because you don't have responsibilities, priorities, or goals so important that you have no choice but to focus on them. You're afraid to commit so you drown in options.
A meaningful goal + clarity on how to achieve it + a real deadline closing in = the greatest nootropic stack known to man
No amount of thinking is going to fix the problem that is solved by doing.
The best creatives do everything in their power to minimize the time between inspiration and creation.

"What skill should I learn" = researching the same thing as everyone else wondering the same thing.

"What project am I building" = a learning path that is completely unique to you, because you're creating it on the go.

Stop asking yourself what skill you should learn.

Start learning the specific techniques necessary to build a project.

Then, launch the project, note feedback, learn, fix mistakes, and do it again.

The more quality projects you build, the more irreplaceable your skill stack.

One meaningful project.
One hour of focused work.
One day at a time, without fail.

If you're trying to make your part-time your full-time, this is the secret you're looking for.

urls.title: How Smart Creators Will Grow An Audience From Zero In 2025
urls.description: Follower count doesn't matter anymore. Beginners can start from zero followers and go viral thanks to social media's switch to an interest graph. Here's what...

data.text:
Social media is changing.

Follower count barely matters anymore, but content, newsletters, and long-form matter more than ever.

Now that anyone can go viral, here's how the audience building game has changed:
https://t.co/W3GGba00xm
you can do incredible things in 365 hours https://t.co/mTY2f3QDyj
If you aren't tired when you go to bed and excited when you wake up, you need a meaningful project that demands you at your best.

If you want a better understanding of your mind & reality, here are your study plans for the next year:

- Spiral dynamics
- Systems thinking
- Structure VS content
- Cybernetics
- Self-bias and deception
- Developmental psychology

Your ability to think will climb a few levels.
When you know what you don't want, it doesn't matter if you are crystal clear on what you want. You'll figure it out.

I've reached the stage where I only want to be around people who take their craft seriously.

People who've realized that constant complaining is destructive and useless. People who are focused on making the most of their next 24 hours. People who are clear on what they want.

If you value:

- Self-actualization
- Self-education
- Exploring new perspectives
- Having value to contribute

And feel like you aren't doing the work you were meant to do, try this:
https://t.co/Q5QYaJBv8H

Your 20s are the tutorial phase.

You're fresh out of society's programming. You have the chance to start over, experiment, and explore. The worst thing you can do is stop learning, obey and end up 60 years old with the beliefs of your 20-year-old self.

A few of the simplest things you can do when you want to change your state:

- Go on a walk
- Journal all thoughts
- Breath deep for 10 minutes
- Read philosophy
- Practice metacognition
- Write your way out

If you can crack open your mind a bit, you can start to squeeze out.

When you're stressed, you regress into a version of your past self.

Your mind closes up.

It's incredibly difficult to zoom out and see that there are a few potential paths you can start to go down.

If you're smart, you have faith in the path, and you step forward anyway.

If you aren't in the right state of mind, you're more likely to see this tweet as a personal attack and play victim about how "it's hard" or how you can't change.

Everything's hard, but we all know you're deceiving yourself if you don't think there's a way out.

Your state of mind influences how you see the world.

How you see the world influences what opportunities you act on.

What you act on influences your quality of life.

If you're always stressed and anxious, that will slowly drag you down until you decide to change it.
Your potential is determined by how much uncertainty you're willing to embrace.

Work that is destructive to human health is bound to be replaced.

Anything that forces you to stare at screens, sit under fluorescent lights, doesn't allow time for rest, encourages convenient food, etc.

Tech and AI are can finally solve this problem, and it will happen fast.

Most things can be done quite well on a walk now:

- Writing
- Research
- Meetings
- Emails
- Marketing
- Admin work

And as AI continues to develop more work becomes more feasible to do on a walk.

My ideal lifestyle:

> Live somewhere with nice weather
> Limit time at desk to ~2 hours a day
> Do all other work outside on a walk
> Outsource or remove work that requires otherwise
> Fill free time with learning, training, and time with friends / family
how to take back control of your life https://t.co/hOEquzKL8A
Surround yourself with people who make you want to be better. Not because they tell you to, but because their actions make you realize what's possible.
Don't doubt the person who hates their current situation so much that it becomes an infinite source of motivation and focus.

urls.title: Kortex | The AI Powered Second Brain
urls.description: Finally, one place for all of your ideas, notes, highlights, and writing. Capture any idea, synthesize your workspace with AI, and write notes or documents quick.

data.text:
Again, it's free for personal use.

Join the waitlist here and you'll receive access quite soon (possibly within 24 hours).

We've rolled out over 23,000 invites so far.

https://t.co/H2qBxCRefp

Here are a few notable features on our roadmap:

- Capture voice transcription
- AI synthesis (turn captures into summaries, outlines, and notes)
- Autotags and connections
-  functionality (books, articles, YT transcriptions)
- AI chat for research
- Desktop capture from

4) The future of writing

Like Sam Altman, we don't think the nature of writing is going to change.

Sure, you can have AI write meaningless things like school essays.

But we want to make it so you only have to focus on the quality of your ideas.

AI can do the grunt work. https://t.co/HuPdjZBJnY

3) Elements, Connections, Tags

The biggest pain points our users experienced with other apps:

- Confusing and overwhelming
- Ideas split across apps
- Still hitting writers block

We help you discover new ideas fast.

And create outlines, templates, swipe files: https://t.co/r52HC16SoM

2) Library

To write well, you need access to your ideas, highlights, files, notes, AND previous writing.

Most apps are great at jumbling this all up into a bunch of documents that get lost.

Library is a place for all external ideas: https://t.co/ev5DpFCP5E

1) Capture

There isn't a single app on the market (note-taking or writing) that does this:

Ideas don't belong in long running documents.

Ideas are individual building blocks for your writing, notes, and projects.

They should be treated as such.

Watch on 2x speed: https://t.co/oy2FiIPFlg

In other words, Kortex, right now, can be considered a minimalist version of Notion or Obsidian with sharing like Google Docs.

But with a UI that biases novel ideas and the flow state.

To some, it's not worth the switch just yet.

To others, they can't live without it:

In order to build the future of writing, we needed a sturdy base.

Not just some new AI powered document editor, but a second brain for all of your knowledge.

This took time.

While we have AI features coming (as we'll discuss), we needed to master the writing experience first. https://t.co/jIw3YxzLDG

"Somebody is going to create – or already has – a great tool to write in a new way… helping you discover new things in the idea space." – Sam Altman

This is why we built Kortex.

The future of writing apps.

And we made it free:
Reverting back, hair will catch up https://t.co/oJrH1qcrtW

AI making work optional will be a massive blessing and curse. Nobody wants to be on vacation forever. Early retirement is the opposite of the challenge your psyche craves for meaning.

People who use it as an opportunity to fuel their passions will thrive.

I believe many rich people are unhappy for one reason: they stop solving problems. Any time some small challenge comes up, they pay for it to be done. They outsource their sense of accomplishment. They use money to make life easy, but it becomes more difficult instead.

urls.title: It's actually pretty easy to focus 12 hours a day (if you do this)
urls.description: I've talked about the 4 hour workday many times in the past. But life isn't static. When you feel the pull to become obsessed with your purpose, do it. If yo...

data.text:
Focus is less about discipline and more about removing distractions that drain your motivation and make you feel lost.

You will never force quality work from that low energy state.

Here’s what you do if you want to focus for hours on your purpose: https://t.co/aLpgP2SRCs

What I mean by the intelligence part:
https://t.co/hRXx1MtZuw

Most people wait to get lucky.

Experimentation determines how lucky you can get.

The worst thing you can do is stick with a tactic that isn't working (when there absolutely is something you can do that will get results).

A lack of experimentation is a lack of intelligence.

I'm bullish on the creator economy because (1) ideas are infinite (2) ideas shape the future (3) education becomes affordable and tailored to personality (4) encourages growth, uniqueness, and value.

Being a creator isn't a job. It's a vessel to be yourself full-time.

urls.title: How Smart Creators Will Build An Audience In 2025 - Dan Koe
urls.description: Your follower count doesn't matter anymore. We're going back to the old way of building an audience.

data.text:
Follower count doesn't matter anymore.

Well, not as much as it used to.

The good thing is that beginners can grow just as fast as large creators (if they know what they're doing).

The future of audience building is here:
https://t.co/VKN0OJjEJc

To recap:

- You are the niche
- Vision over target audience
- Content ecosystems over funnels
- Create a world for people to explore

If you enjoyed this thread, share it:
https://t.co/4DW26pXAtx

If you were to stick with this for 1 year, you would have:

- 1095 posts on each platform
- 104 threads / short YT videos
- 52 newsletters / YT videos

If you fail with that amount of volume, I don't know what to tell you.

I don't recommend starting on all platforms right away.

Master content writing first.

Then, when you can do this full time, bump your 1 hour of writing up to 2 hours of writing and repurposing.

Your brand and income compound with the more quality content you put out.

4) Repurposing

The beauty of this system is that writing is repurposable.

Posts can be copy/pasted across all social media (or turned into short video scripts).

Threads are turned into carousels or short YT videos.

Newsletters turn into YT or podcast scripts.
